profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T18:17-0400

did.unittitle: Archive for the History of Quantum Physics, 1898-1950 (bulk)
did.abstract: Primary source materials for the history of quantum physics in the twentieth century, collected under the auspices of the American Philosophical Society and the American Physical Society, with a grant from the National Science Foundation.

origination.corpname: American Physical Society and American Philosophical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Initially purchased and accessioned, 1967. See in-house shelf list for additional dates and sources.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals of part of this collection are in: Niels Bohr Archives, Universitets Institut for Teoretisk Fysik, Copenhagen.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: The collection is also described and analyzed in: Kuhn, Thomas S.; Heilbron, John L.; Forman, Paul; and Allen, Lini; eds., Sources for the History of Quantum Physics: An Inventory and Report, (Philadelphia: American Philosophical Society, 1967).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p:
For transcripts of the oral history interviews, as well as the working papers of the Committee which includes correspondence with famous figures in physics, with some memoirs, photographs, lectures, etc., see
Mss 530.1 Ar2.5.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collected papers of physicists preserved on microfilm by the Archive for the History of Quantum Physics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This card catalog was prepared at the Bohr Sekretariat by Fru E. Tanggaard and Mag. E. Rüdinger. For many of the pre-1923 letters Rüdinger prepared, and the card bears, a summary of the contents of the letter and English translations of key phrases. All cards which had been annotated at the time of filming appear also on Microfilms BSC 1-8.
